results.title: Building a set
results.creator_credit: International Film Bureau, Wesley Greene, Robert Edmonds and Betty Edmonds
results.brief_description: From the designer’s plans, the carpenter and back stage crew build the set. Drawing an outline on the stage floor (so rehearsals can go on), the crew order material, build flats and complete platforms and other details.

results.title: Building a highway
results.brief_description: A survey of the role of highways in America’s system of transportation and the major processes of roadbuilding including: first surveying, cutting, scraping and levelling of the roadbed; assembling materials; mixing and dumping concrete; smoothing and finishing surface; necessary skills involved to ensure safe, well-built highways.

results.title: Build yourself a world H.S.
results.creator_credit: Stewart's Films, John R.F. Stewart and Richard Need
results.brief_description: Traces the evolution of civil engineering, from man’s first tools to the structures of today. Shows that the present day civil engineer designs his project not only as a functional structure but also to take its place in its surroundings

results.title: Build a better bag lunch
results.creator_credit: Alfred Higgins Productions and Stephen Wallen
results.brief_description: Shows in a humurous and playful way that packed lunches can vary in content and style every day, and that the packed lunch can help control one’s salt, sugar and fat intake. Suggests many combinations of fillings from the main food groups, and shows the important role of vacuum containers. Suitable for upper primary and lower secondary levels.

results.title: Bugsy Malone
results.creator_credit: Goodtimes Enterprises, Alan Marshall, David Puttnam and Allan Parker
results.brief_description: A mad gangster musical set in the New York of the 1920s, a world of would-be hoodlums, show girls and dreamers. But there are no adults, only children. Bugsy, Blousey, Tallulah, Fat Sam, Fizzy, Leroy and Loney are some of the characters involved in a bitter gang war for possession of the dreaded “spurge gun”. Stars a very young Jodie Foster.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Goodtimes Enterprises, Alan Marshall, David Puttnam and Allan Parker

results.title: Bugsy
results.creator_credit: Tri-Star Pictures, Mulholland Productions, Baltimore Pictures, Warren Beatty, Barry Levinson and Mark Johnson
results.brief_description: This is a bio-pic of legendary gangster Benjamin “Bugsy” Siegel (Warren Beatty), a mobster who had a vision for a gambling mecca in the Nevada desert. Directed by Barry Levinson (Diner, Rain man, Good morning Vietnam, Wag the dog), the film plots Bugsy’s rise to infamy as a crook and ruthless power broker in LA throughout the 1940s. It also documents Bugsy’s tumultuous relationship with Hollywood starlet, Virginia Hill (Annette Bening) who seduces Bugsy with Tinseltown glamour, despite the fact that he is married with children. Bugsy is depicted as a vain, sartorial womaniser whose violent ways make him feared and loathed amidst the mobsters with whom he fraternises. His ultimate extravagant dream, to see a bacchanalian oasis in the desert, is built with the funds of his ruthless mob boss Meyer Lanksky (Ben Kingsley). Harvey Keitel stars as gangster Mickey Cohen, with whom Bugsy falls into a longstanding business arrangement. The aesthetic of 1940s Hollywood - the cars, clothes, architecture and lifestyle - is lovingly re-created here in detail. Original music composed by Ennio Morricone. Winner of two Oscars for art direction and costume, the film was nominated for eight others.

results.title: Bugs Bunny in King Arthur's court
results.brief_description: Chuck Jones has completely turned around the classic Mark Twain story and created his own wonderful world of chaos and mayhem in Camelot for this television special of “Bugs Bunny in King Arthur’s Court” (aka “A Connecticut Yankee in King Arthur’s Court”). The plot is basically the same but of course there are many new twists and the characters take on their very own familiar personalities including Daffy Duck as King Arthur, Yosemite Sam as the scheming Black Knight, Merlin of Monroe, Porky Pig as the bumbling Sir Loin of Pork and Elmer Fudd as the dragon-hating (or wabbit-hating) Sir Elmer of Fudde. King Arthur’s Court and the Round Table will never be quite the same again with the arrival of Bugges Bunnye of Carrot Patchville, USA. This is a very clever and witty interpretation of the original story “produced, directed and plagiarized by Chuck Jones”.
